This is an adaptation of a play and it shows, but is also a great forgotten movie with Alec Guinness and Jack Hawkins about the power of State over the individual and crushing ideals. It´s from 1955, when all East European was dominated by Communism, but the subject still is actual. It´s a great companion piece wih the novel Darkness at Noon, from Arthur Koestler (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Darkness_at_Noon). 

Peter Glenville would direct a few years later BECKET, with Richard Burton and Peter O'Toole, one of the greatest british movies ever made.
